Uses of Position in jbb.engine.mouseland
 

Methods in jbb.engine.mouseland that return Position
 Position MouseHero.getNextPosition(Position position)
          the getNextPosition method uses a position as the parameter and returns the next position It also checks to see what direction the MouseHero is going and will setImage() according to the direction.
 Position Mouse.getNextPosition(Position position)
          the getNextPosition method uses a position as the parameter and returns the next position, It keeps in memory the previous positions and checks to see if the mouse is stuck in a corner, (or if the mouse is going back and forth, from one position to another), and will create a random new position so it leaves the area.
 Position MouseTrap.getTrapPosition()
          The getTrapPosition method returns the Position of the MouseTrap
 

Methods in jbb.engine.mouseland with parameters of type Position
 Position MouseHero.getNextPosition(Position position)
          the getNextPosition method uses a position as the parameter and returns the next position It also checks to see what direction the MouseHero is going and will setImage() according to the direction.
 Position Mouse.getNextPosition(Position position)
          the getNextPosition method uses a position as the parameter and returns the next position, It keeps in memory the previous positions and checks to see if the mouse is stuck in a corner, (or if the mouse is going back and forth, from one position to another), and will create a random new position so it leaves the area.
 boolean MouseHero.hasGoodie(Position position)
          the hasGoodie method true if the tile MouseHero is currently on is of instance of Mouse Trap, else false
 boolean Mouse.hasGoodie(Position position)
          the hasGoodie method checks to see if Mouse walked over a Mouse Trap on the position given (which is the parameter), if yes, it checks to see if the MouseTrap is set or used and if used returns false and if set returns true.
